newsitem.title: USA: Wrigley has higher quarter, offers extra payout.
newsitem.headline: Wrigley has higher quarter, offers extra payout.

text.p: Wm. Wrigley Jr. Co., the chewing gum maker, Tuesday reported higher third quarter earnings and declared an extra quarterly dividend based on the improved results.
However, Wall Street analysts had expected the candy company to report even stronger numbers, sending the company's stock down 25 cents to close at $59.875 on the New York Stock Exchange.
"The third quarter looks a little short of expectations," said Prudential Securities analyst John McMillin.
Wrigley reported third quarter earnings of $61.2 million, or 53 cents a share. A year earlier it earned $58.3 million, or 50 cents a share.
The third quarter results were below the First Call consensus of 55 cents a share.
Revenues rose to $466.1 million from $435.4 million a year earlier.
Wrigley's third quarter included a charge of $1.0 million to close a plant in Santa Cruz, Calif.
Earlier, Wrigley declared an extra dividend of 34 cents a share, bringing its full-year 1996 dividend to $1.02 a share.
The extra dividend is payable December 16 to stockholders of record December 6.
The gum manufacturer also voted a regular 17 cent per share payout for the three-month period beginning Feb. 3, 1997.
